conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into after passing through baffles.

Point A is connected to a black baffle, point B to a light yellow baffle, point C to a dark yellow baffle, and point D to a white baffle. Containers E, F, and G are green, red, and white respectively.
Liquid exits at point A, flows downward along the black baffle, turns left, and flows into container E.
Liquid exits at point B, flows downward along the light yellow baffle, turns left, and flows into container F.
Liquid exits at point C, flows downward along the dark yellow baffle, turns right, and flows into container G.
Liquid exits at point D, flows downward along the white baffle, turns left, and flows into container G.
Liquid from A flows into E.
Liquid from B flows into F.
Liquid from C flows into G.
Liquid from D flows into G.
Container E receives the liquid from A.
Container F receives the liquid from B.
Container G receives the liquids from both C and D.
